H0.text: What was the capital of the United States between 1785 and 1790. Philadelphia

H1.text: What was the capital of the United States between 1785 and 1790. Boston

H2.text: What was the capital of the United States between 1785 and 1790. Baltimore

H3.text: What was the capital of the United States between 1785 and 1790. Ny

A4.text: Philadelphia served as capital of the United States for most of the colonial and early post-colonial period, including for a decade, from 1790 to 1800, while Washington, D.C. was being constructed and prepared to serve as the new national capital, and on five prior occasions between 1776 and 1790.

A5.text: The capital of the United States was moved to Washington, D.C. in 1800 upon completion of the White House and U.S. Capitol buildings.
